definition:
One can construct the polars of a polynomial by means of a differential
operator. Suppose we have a homogeneous polynomial
$p (x_1, \ldots, x_n)$. To compute the polars of $p$ we act on it with
the operator $\Delta = y_1 \, \partial / \partial x_1 + \cdots 
+y_n \, \partial / \partial x_n$; the $k$-th polar of $p$ equals
$\Delta^k p(x_1, \ldots x_n)$.
